citation.article-title: Bordetella trematum sp. nov., isolated from wounds and ear infections in humans, and reassessment of Alcaligenes denitrificans Rüger and Tan 1983.

p.s: Description of Bordetella trematum sp. nov.

Bordetella trematum (tre.ma'tum. Gr. neut. n. trema, referring to something pierced or penetrated, an aperture, or a gap; N. L. gen. pl. n. trematum, pertaining to penetrated or open things, referring to the presence of these bacteria in wounds and other exposed parts of the human body)
B. trematum cells are gram-negative, non-spore-forming, capsulated rods that are motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Motility does not differ significantly when cells are grown at 25, 30, or 37°C.
In 16- to 24-h-old cultures on blood agar, the average cell is 0.5 to 0.6 μm wide and 1 to 1.8 μm long; the longest rods are up to 2.4 μm long.
Strains produce convex, circular, and greyish cream white colonies with entire edges on blood agar.
The strains do not require special growth factors and grow on conventional media.
Growth is not inhibited at an incubation temperature of 4TC, but is reduced markedly at 25°C.
Strains grow microaerobically, but not anaerobically.
Colonies grown for 16 to 24 h on transparent D.
S.
T. agar at 37°C exhibit greenish yellow to yellow-red iridescence in obliquely transmitted light under a stereomicroscope.
Other biochemical characteristics are described above and in Table 4.

The major fatty acid components of all of the strains examined are 12:0 2OH (about 3%), 14:0 2OH (about 5%), 16:0 (about 37%), 17:0 cyclo (about 32%), 16:0 2OH (about 2%), 18:O (about 4%), and summed feature 3 (probably 14:0 3OH) (about 10%).
Strains have been isolated from ear infections and wounds of humans, but not from respiratory systems.
Pathogenic significance is unknown.
The DNA base composition is between 64 and 65 mol% G+C.
The type strain is strain LMG 13506, which was isolated from a chronic ear infection in Germany.
Its G+C content is 65 mol%.
All B. trematum strains have been deposited in the Laboratorium Microbiologie Gent Culture Collection.
